reviewText:
Hi
Remember going to see Rex Allen  Movies in 40's and 50's
Think Gene Autry helped him get started'
Still enjoy the old western movies
Thanks
RLO
My daughter loves horse movies. She enjoyed this one  a lot. If you large running out of  nice family movies, watch this.
What a delightful way to portray the intelligence and love of an animal towards humans.
"Phantom"? We see him several times! However, pretty good otherwise. Rex Allen can sing. Fun diversion for a little while, if you enjoy old black & white.
great old horse movie ! Loved it !
Nice to see Slim Pickens again. Other than that it was pretty painful. Story line is full of holes.
Loved it!!
Fun little movie, a bit better than I expected, pretty much typical of the time and genre.
liked it
GREAT FOR NOSTALGIA
I liked that the plot wasn't the typical good guy gets the girl in the end! First time watching a Rex Allen film. He seems more believable as a cowboy than Gene Autry or Roy Rogers.

I liked the movie and the reason I wanted to add it to my collection is it is one of the last b-westerns made. I'm still a fan of the b-westerns
from the 1930s and 1940s.
Good family movie.
8 year old daughter could not get into the movie at all.  We watched Black Beauty instead.  :(
I love the older movies, good actors also, story plot good, been watching the old westerns ever since I was able to have a TV in the house, old school here when it comes to the movies
I love movies with and about horses this old move was great
This one is just wonderful taking me on a journey of days past to the wholesome westerners of my youth.
it was to old of a movie for us.
another love rex allen movie.
I'll always be in love with horses and Rex Allen was "my" cowboy when growing up.  Good easy listen.
